description.narrative: For The project supports collaborative dispute resolution between farmers and herders in the Logone Occidental (Western Logone) region of Chad. The initative will include a 12-month pilot program working with farmers, pastoralists, local authorities, and civil society to analyze conflicts and existing management processes. The centerpiece of the project will be local trainings and community forums throughout the region to address current perceptions of conflicts, resolution mechanisms, and future scenarios, including sharing existing research data. The project will organize roundtables with government and customary authorities to analyze emerging conflict risks. A final report will document the results of this process, highlighting successful local models and solutions, as well as the process of thinking through the impact of climate and demographic changes in the region. Radio programs will disseminate information about this process to a broad audience
